location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.184 of 1850 from the Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of the receipt of Hennell's recent letters describing the escalating feud between the Suhar and Muscat families. The Secretary informs Hennell that the Honorable Company's Steamer Aucklandis being despatched to Bushire, to be put under the Resident's orders for the purposes of keeping the maritime peace on the Muscat and Suhar coasts.
